data: CARD STEMI Post Fibrinolytic Therapy - Ongoing Management (Module)
Medications
Ensure inital doses of antiplatelets have been administered
ASA EC
81 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab-EC
clopidogrel
75 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab
For patients 75 years or less
Select enoxaparin (preferred) or heparin (use CARD Heparin Infusion Post Fibrinolytic (Module))
Enoxaparin is CONTRAINDICATED if eGFR is less than 30 mL/min or if patient has known or suspected renal insufficiency
Ensure initial dose of anticoagulants have been administered
enoxaparin
1 mg/kg, subcutaneous, q12h, order duration: 8 day, drug form: inj
100 mg, subcutaneous, q12h, order duration: 8 day, drug form: inj
For patients older than 75 years
Select fondaparinux (preferred) or heparin (use CARD Heparin Infusion Post Fibrinolytic (Module))
fondaparinux CONTRAINDICATED if eGFR is LESS than 30 mL/min; possibility of PCI in the next 7 days
fondaparinux
2.5 mg, subcutaneous, qPM, order duration: 7 day
caRVEDILOl target dose: 25 mg PO BID
caRVEDILOl
3.125 mg, PO, BID, drug form: tab
6.25 mg, PO, BID, drug form: tab
12.5 mg, PO, BID, drug form: tab
25 mg, PO, BID, drug form: tab
50 mg, PO, BID, drug form: tab
bisOPROLOL target dose: 10 mg PO Daily
bisOPROLOL
2.5 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab
1.25 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab
5 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab
10 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab
metoprolol target dose: 100 mg PO BID
metoprolol
25 mg, PO, BID, drug form: tab
12.5 mg, PO, BID, drug form: tab
50 mg, PO, BID, drug form: tab
100 mg, PO, BID, drug form: tab
Re-assess therapy if serum creatinine increases by more than 30% or if serum potassium rises above 5.2 mmol/L
ramipril
2.5 mg, PO, BID, drug form: cap
1.25 mg, PO, BID, drug form: cap
5 mg, PO, BID, drug form: cap
2.5 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: cap
5 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: cap
10 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: cap
perindopril
4 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab
2 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab
8 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab
Avoid combination of ACE Inhibitor with ARB
Angiotensin Receptor Blocker (ARB) - indicated for ACE- inhibitor intolerance
Re-assess therapy if serum creatinine increases by more than 30% or if serum potassium rises above 5.2 mmol/L
candesartan
8 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab
4 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab
16 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab
32 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab
valsartan
40 mg, PO, BID, drug form: tab
80 mg, PO, BID, drug form: tab
160 mg, PO, BID, drug form: tab
losartan
25 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab
50 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab
75 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab
100 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab

Avoid nitroglycerin if any of the following are present:   - SBP below 90 mmHg or if more than 30 mmHg drop from baseline  - Suspected right ventricular infarction  - Recent use of phosphodiesterase inhibitors; within 24 hours for sildenafil [VIAGRA] and vardenafil [LEVITRA]; within 48 hours for tadalafil [CIALIS]
nitroglycerin 0.4 mg/spray spray
1 spray, sublingual, q5min, PRN other (see comment), drug form: spray
nitroglycerin titratable infusion (0.2 mg/mL) in D5W standard
Titrate, IV, 10 mcg/min starting rate, 0 mcg/min minimum rate, 200 mcg/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: Titrate by 10 mcg/min, q5min PRN for symptoms of ischemia; maintain SPB above 90 mmHg
50 mg
Diagnostic Tests
Conditional Order - One Time
If/when fibrinolytic therapy is given, then RN to place an order for Electrocardiogram 12 Lead 60 minutes post administration
Communication Orders
Communication Order
Ensure an evaluation of Left Ventricular function is acquired prior to discharge
